p: The antimicrobial activity of compound 367 was evaluated using the strains of methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus, Klebsiella pneumoniae, Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Bacillus subtilis, and Escherichia coli. Compound 367 exhibited weaker activity in comparison to the positive control tetracycline against methicillin-resistant S. aureus (MRSA) with the MIC value of 128 µg/mL, and against K. pneumoniae and P. aeruginosa with equal MIC values of 32 µg/mL [ 119].
